## AppBuilder.onInit() method

Set the initialization handler.

**Signature:**

```typescript
onInit(handler: InitHandler<State, Components>): AppBuilder<State, Components>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

handler


</td><td>

[InitHandler](./dsl.inithandler.md)<!-- -->&lt;State, Components&gt;


</td><td>

Function to call on initialization


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

[AppBuilder](./dsl.appbuilder.md)<!-- -->&lt;State, Components&gt;

A new [AppBuilder](./dsl.appbuilder.md) with the init handler registered

## Remarks

The init handler is called once when the application starts. Use it to schedule initial async operations like fetching data or starting timers. Calling this method multiple times will replace the previous handler.

## Example


```typescript
createApp()
  .onInit(({ schedule }) => {
    schedule(tick(1000, () => new MyMessage()))
  })
```
